A widely used indicator for the relative attractiveness of renewable energy but also development of
(LCOE). It is applied by a wide range of public
stakeholders when tracking progress with regard to cost degression
. LCOE calculation methodologies vary but in principle, consider project
. Besides other weaknesses, the LCOE concept usually does not consider societal costs resulting
sking instruments and/or other public interventions/support and therefore caution has to be
applied when using the LCOE as the indicator sole of the success of enabling environments. The yearly
IRENA mapping on renewable energy auction results demonstrates
LCOEs (equal to the agreed tariffs) for renewable energy which can be observed

USD/kWh with a global weighted average of 0
